article.text: GENEVA, April 11 (Xinhua) -- The Syrian government has decided "to cease all military fighting throughout Syrian territory" by 6 a.m. Damascus time on Thursday, a spokesman for UN-Arab League joint special envoy Kofi Annan said on Wednesday. According to a message from Annan's spokesperson Ahmad Fawzi, Annan received a letter from the Syrian foreign minister informing him of the decision to halt fighting. Meanwhile, the Syrian government also reserved "the right to respond proportionately to any attacks carried out by armed terrorist groups against civilians, Government forces or public and private property," accroding to the letter. Fawzi said Annan would continue to work with the Syrian government and the opposition to ensure the comprehensive implementation of the six-point plan.
